contentrichtext.text: {{ref improve|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox German district| name=Ansbach| state=Bavaria| capital=[[Ansbach]]| regierungsbezirk=[[Mittelfranken]]| area=1972|Kreisschlüssel = 09571 | population=183,700| population_as_of=2001| density=93| carsign=AN| url=[http://www.landkreis-ansbach.de landkreis-ansbach.de]| map=Bavaria an.png }} '''Ansbach''' is a district in [[Bavaria]], [[Germany]]. It is surrounding, but not including the city of [[Ansbach]]; nonetheless the administrative seat of the district is Ansbach. It is the district with the biggest area in Bavaria. The district is bounded by (from the west and clockwise) the districts [[Ostalbkreis]], [[Schwäbisch Hall (district)|Schwäbisch Hall]] and [[Main-Tauber (district)|Main-Tauber]] (all in the state of [[Baden-Württemberg]]), and the districts of [[Neustadt (Aisch)-Bad Windsheim]], [[Fürth (district)|Fürth]], [[Roth (district)|Roth]], [[Weißenburg-Gunzenhausen]] and [[Donau-Ries]]. == History == Some of the towns already existed during the lifetime of [[Charlemagne]], who visited Feuchtwangen about 800. In the 13th century the towns of Rothenburg, Dinkelsbühl and Feuchtwangen were elevated to Free Imperial Cities; so they were directly subordinate to the Holy Roman Emperor. The city of Ansbach became subject to the [[Hohenzollern]] family, who established the state of Ansbach (later Brandenburg-Ansbach) in the region. The district of Ansbach was established in 1972, when the former districts of Ansbach, Dinkelsbühl, Feuchtwangen and Rothenburg were merged. The city of Rothenburg lost its status as an [[List of German urban districts|urban district]] and was incorporated into the district. == Geography == Ansbach is the largest district of Bavaria. Its northern half is occupied by the '''Frankenhöhe''', a gentle hilly countryside. The southern parts are covered with heaths and forests. The source of the [[Altmühl]] River is located in the district. == Coat of arms == {| |- valign=top ||[[Image:Wappen Landkreis Ansbach.png|100px|Coat of arms]] ||The coat of arms displays: * top left: the black and white arms of the [[Hohenzollern]] dynasty, who ruled the former state of Brandenburg-Ansbach * top right: the red and white arms of [[Franconia]] * bottom: the heraldic eagle of the [[Holy Roman Empire]], which stands for the former Free Imperial Cities of Rothenburg, Dinkelsbühl and Feuchtwangen |} == Towns and municipalities == {| ! align=left width=33%|Towns (Städte) ! align=left width=33%|Municipalities ! align=left width=33%| |- valign=top || #[[Dinkelsbühl]] #[[Feuchtwangen]] #[[Heilsbronn]] #[[Herrieden]] #[[Leutershausen]] #[[Merkendorf, Bavaria|Merkendorf]] #[[Ornbau]] #[[Rothenburg ob der Tauber]] #[[Schillingsfürst]] #[[Wassertrüdingen]] #[[Windsbach]] #[[Wolframs-Eschenbach]] || #[[Adelshofen, Middle Franconia|Adelshofen]] #[[Arberg]] #[[Aurach]] #[[Bechhofen]] #[[Bruckberg, Middle Franconia|Bruckberg]] #[[Buch am Wald]] #[[Burgoberbach]] #[[Burk, Bavaria|Burk]] #[[Colmberg]] #[[Dentlein]] #[[Diebach]] #[[Dietenhofen]] #[[Dombühl]] #[[Dürrwangen]] #[[Ehingen, Middle Franconia|Ehingen]] #[[Flachslanden]] #[[Gebsattel]] #[[Gerolfingen]] #[[Geslau]] #[[Insingen]] #[[Langfurth]] #[[Lehrberg]] || <ol start=23> <li> [[Lichtenau, Bavaria|Lichtenau]] <li> [[Mitteleschenbach]] <li> [[Mönchsroth]] <li> [[Neuendettelsau]] <li> [[Neusitz]] <li> [[Oberdachstetten]] <li> [[Ohrenbach]] <li> [[Petersaurach]] <li> [[Röckingen]] <li> [[Rügland]] <li> [[Sachsen bei Ansbach|Sachsen]] <li> [[Schnelldorf]] <li> [[Schopfloch, Bavaria|Schopfloch]] <li> [[Steinsfeld]] <li> [[Unterschwaningen]] <li> [[Weidenbach, Bavaria|Weidenbach]] <li> [[Weihenzell]] <li> [[Weiltingen]] <li> [[Wettringen, Bavaria|Wettringen]] <li> [[Wieseth]] <li> [[Wilburgstetten]] <li> [[Windelsbach]] <li> [[Wittelshofen]] <li> [[Wörnitz]] </ol> |} ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == {{commonscat|Landkreis Ansbach}} *[http://www.landkreis-ansbach.de Official Website] (German) *[http://www.frankenhoehe.de/ Frankenhöhe] (German) {{Germany_districts_bavaria}} {{coord|49.33|10.5|display=title|format=dms}} [[Category:Ansbach (district)| ]]
